item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 27, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Should elephants have the same rights as people? A Colorado court may decide (25 points | 17 comments)
2. Shrunked JavaScript monorepo Git size by 94% (82 points | 19 comments)
3. Typeset: An HTML pre-proces­sor for web ty­pog­ra­phy (17 points | 5 comments)
4. I discovered mysterious hidden signals on a public radio channel (2013) [video] (121 points | 20 comments)
5. James Webb Telescope discovers some quasars that seem to exist in isolation (37 points | discuss)
6. Canvas Fingerprinting (72 points | 61 comments)
7. Understanding Round Robin DNS (265 points | 99 comments)
8. How JPEG XL compares to other image codecs (89 points | 28 comments)
9. First scientific study of the Paris catacombs (15 points | discuss)
10. How 'Factorio' seduced Silicon Valley and me (187 points | 214 comments)
11. ZombAIs: From Prompt Injection to C2 with Claude Computer Use (116 points | 52 comments)
12. Moonshine, the new state of the art for speech to text (32 points | 4 comments)
13. How the human brain contends with the strangeness of zero (18 points | 9 comments)
14. Fundamentals of Radiance Cascades (84 points | 21 comments)
15. Debugging my wife's alarm clock (28 points | 8 comments)
16. Codeberg Reconsidering OSI License Approval in Terms of Use (13 points | discuss)
17. Using LLMs to enhance our testing practices (106 points | 47 comments)
18. Tell HN: GpuOwl/PRPLL, GPU software used to find the largest prime number (48 points | 14 comments)
19. Using a BCI with LLM for enabling ALS patients to speak again with family (42 points | 15 comments)
20. Olivetti’s Ivrea (50 points | 10 comments)
21. The Fediverse is getting its own TikTok competitor called Loops (18 points | 13 comments)
22. Goodhart's law isn't as useful as you might think (2023) (71 points | 41 comments)
23. Comparison of configuration file languages (2016) (3 points | discuss)
24. Carma (YC W24) hiring founding SWEs (remote) to build the next Uber for auto repair ( | hide)
25. Slot Machines Walk into a Bar: Adventures in Quantity over Quality [video] (5 points | discuss)
26. Order and orient the keys on your keychain (52 points | 63 comments)
27. Google to develop AI that takes over computers, The Information reports (5 points | 2 comments)
28. Deep dive: the instability of op-amps (97 points | 36 comments)
29. A brief history of Mac firmware (34 points | 5 comments)
30. The Mindlessness of Ostensibly Thoughtful Action (1978) [pdf] (40 points | 6 comments)
